abstract: The JPMorgan Chase chief’s continued presence on the board of the New York Fed fits into a dangerous historical pattern of undue influence by powerful interests, an economist writes.
snippet: The JPMorgan Chase chief’s continued presence on the board of the New York Fed fits into a dangerous historical pattern of undue influence by powerful interests, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Simon Johnson is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of “White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.”

headline.main: Jamie Dimon and the Fall of Nations

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Federal Reserve Bank of New York

abstract: After days of discussions, Jamie Dimon of JPMorgan Chase has agreed to testify before the Senate Banking Committee on June 13, and he is also expected to appear before a House panel later in the month.
snippet: After days of discussions, Jamie Dimon of JPMorgan Chase has agreed to testify before the Senate Banking Committee on June 13, and he is also expected to appear before a House panel later in the month.

headline.main: JPMorgan’s Chief to Testify Twice in June

abstract: On Thursday, the Commodity Futures Trading Commission held a public roundtable to solicit ideas from banks, academics and other experts on the contentious Volcker Rule, which seeks to ban banks from making risky bets with their own money.
snippet: On Thursday, the Commodity Futures Trading Commission held a public roundtable to solicit ideas from banks, academics and other experts on the contentious Volcker Rule, which seeks to ban banks from making risky bets with their own money.
lead_paragraph: In the wake of JPMorgan’s multibillion-dollar trading loss, regulators are under pressure to beef up the proposed Volcker Rule.

headline.main: Pressure Continues on Regulators to Approve Volcker Rule

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
